metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0175 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the VirGL virtual OpenGL renderer (virglrenderer). The virgl did not properly initialize memory when allocating a host-backed memory resource. A malicious guest could use this flaw to mmap from the guest kernel and read this uninitialized memory from the host, possibly leading to information disclosure.

criterions.comment: virglrenderer: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
